Description: Fragment of a clay seal-impression, on one side of the rear two coils of basketry, on another one coil of basketry, showing that his piece was located at the lid of a basket. The fine dark brown Nile clay has inclusions of mica, and shows a salt incrustation. The object was hardened after excavation. The top part shows finger impressions and part of a scarab seal, the seal was so deep impressed into the clay that also the side of the scarab with the legs became impressed. The seal is difficult to understand, it looks like a scorpion on a spear, surrounded by a neb and some other signs.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
